info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 17 at 4:28PM EDT until June 17 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 500 PM EDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN MADISON...EAST CENTRAL ROCKINGHAM...SOUTHWESTERN PAGE AND CENTRAL GREENE COUNTIES... At 427 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Shenandoah, or 15 miles west of Madison, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Madison, Shenandoah, Stanardsville, Elkton, Ruckersville, Mcmullen, Criglersville, Ingham, Quinque, Lydia, Haywood, Syria, Banco, Swift Run, Shelby, Fletcher, Graves Mill, Aylor, Jollett and Wolftown. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
